content:
It's wonderful that you're able to apply the skills you've learned from creating your miniature fantasy creature to a more realistic piece, like a sculpture of your friend Emily. Practicing on a real person will help you refine your skills and attention to detail, which will ultimately enhance your ability to create realistic and lifelike sculptures.

It's great that you're building upon your skills and experience, and I'm sure Emily will appreciate the personalized sculpture. Working on a realistic piece will also help you develop your observation skills, as you'll need to study Emily's features and proportions to capture her likeness accurately.

Remember to take your time, be patient, and don't hesitate to ask for feedback from Emily or your instructor. This project is an excellent opportunity to learn and grow as an artist, and I'm sure you'll create a beautiful and meaningful sculpture that Emily will treasure.

How do you plan to approach the sculpture of Emily? Will you be focusing on capturing her personality, facial expression, or a specific pose or gesture that's characteristic of her?
